傻逼暴雪
垃圾

我也算是最早的玩家之一了，免费测试的时候我也参加了。2016年正式开服，我高一，198的ow我考虑了一周，学校中午休息我都要和同学去网吧打两把。现在2023年，上一次好好玩ow还是七年前了。现在的暴雪你就是一坨狗屎，考迪克我cnm。承诺的pve呢，还有尼玛的啥比平衡，一年就jb出一个英雄，玩尼玛比玩，ow2和ow1有啥区别，还不如人家cf加了个hd的变化大，司马暴雪赶紧倒闭吧。为了写个差评还特地下载下来挂了六分钟，这是我对你最后的一点点耐心了。
I'm just doing my part

我爱守望从不后悔，就像我现在恨他一样。
玩了两局依旧是自己最熟悉的手感，但是看到国内已无人关心的新内容，以及各个皮肤变成了灰色，甚至是绝版的直接隐藏，就还是觉得生气。
大家玩的游戏那么多相信也不只有守望的世界需要我们去拯救。
祝你走好，因为你也曾经美好！

怎么说呢，守望先锋就像你的前女友见识到上流生活后从一心做游戏的纯情校园女友变成在夜场上班妄想过着纸醉金迷生活的拜金女，但现在的她发现没人买他的帐又想起大伙在学校为它的付出，想着添上简体中文你又会继续上供，但是大伙都不是傻逼，知道现在的守望先锋有多脑残，唯一存在的目的就是给3D区提供资源，虽然守望先锋烂的批爆，但是3D区的质量因为你蒸蒸日上，只能说多出点烧鸡裂空黑寡妇的皮肤吧

I fucking love(d) this game. I've been a player since 2016. There is just no competetive shooter like it. It's crisp fun gameplay with lots of awesome characters. Colourful and really diverse. I could praise this game till death.

However the current state of this game and Blizzard is just awful. Don't get me wrong, this game is still a ton of fun. But it could be so much more than that. The community took one hit after another just because Blizzard was greedy for money. The devs don't really care about this game anymore, the monetization is horendous with even the scrapped pve recycled missions costing 15 euros. This game feels like pure greed right now, bringing back old features they scrapped in a worse way. The league is dying. And and and.... 

I just wish they would've never announced Overwatch 2 :(

猫

从前，我养了一只猫，我有十块钱，会用八块钱给它买吃的，经常给它洗澡，它也很粘我。

后来，我带它出去玩，路人觉得它很可爱，他们给它喂猫粮，火腿肠，我很不开心，因为它是我的。我想把它抱回家，可是它挣脱我，冲着给它好吃的人喵喵，我抱了几次他都不跟我走，还挠伤了我，于是我转身就走了.....

后来，偶然在路上遇到了它，它身上脏兮兮的。路人们只会给它好吃的，陪它玩玩，却不会带它回家，给它洗澡。它看到我后就跟着我回家，我把它关在了门外，它在门外喵喵地叫着，叫的我很难受，
可是我不会再要它了
。

cat

Once upon a time, I had a cat, I had ten dollars, I would buy it food for eight dollars, bathe it often, and it was very sticky to me.

Later, I took it out to play, passers-by thought it was cute, they fed it cat food, ham sausage, I was very unhappy because it was mine. I wanted to carry it home, but he broke away from me and meowed at the person who gave it good food, I hugged him a few times and he didn't go with me, and scratched me, so I turned around and left.....

Later, I came across it by chance on the road, and it was dirty. Passers-by will only give it good food and play with it, but they will not take it home and bathe it. It saw me and followed me home, I shut it out, it meowed outside the door, it was very uncomfortable,
but I wouldn't want it anymore
.

曾经那个纯粹做游戏的暴雪是最好的游戏公司，从星际、魔兽、暗黑到守望、风暴，所有游戏都有独特的游戏性。剧情世界观宏大，玩法创新，音乐也是经典，到现在这些游戏都还没被霍霍到暴毙全靠着当初的基础在撑。
我玩了12年暴雪各类ip游戏，看着blizzard从顶峰跌落神坛再到人弃狗嫌。看看现在的暴雪，喊着lgbt的怪胎，只想做手游变现的小丑，烤迪克你就继续慢慢折腾吧，都得死。

I've been an OW player since day one, 1000+ hours in the game, a lot of good faith, patience, coping, I've forgiven the devs a lot of bs and questionable shenanigans, but I can't stand the corporate greed that eviscerates the playerbase any longer. If I wanted to kill myself, I'd climb up on your promises and jump down to the level you've delivered. You may have sold out, Blizzard, but we must not, because then we are promoting predatory tactics and anti-consumer practices that will undermine the entire gaming industry. It's sad to see that it has come to this. I would love to insult you, but I’m afraid I won’t do it as well as you did to yourself. So, well done I guess! Pat yourselves on the back and give yourselves a fat end-of-year bonus! We earned it...

How great would it be if a game company would actually focus on making a game fun rather than making long empty promises and not deliver the final product in the end. Highly do no recommend this steaming of pile of garbage for human consumption.
shabiwanyi,caonima

Overwatch 2: A Disheartening Step Backwards

Overwatch 2 had the potential to redefine the trajectory of the beloved franchise and cater to its dedicated fanbase. However, upon diving into the game, one can't help but feel that this sequel not only fails to elevate the experience but rather diminishes it in several critical ways.

Pay-to-Win Dynamics: One of the most glaring issues is the game's apparent move towards a pay-to-win model. While it's understandable that a business needs to generate revenue, Blizzard seems to have forgotten a key principle: respect for the player. Forcing users to choose between shelling out money or investing a near-impossible 60 hours a month to acquire new characters feels like a slap in the face, especially for casual players who can't dedicate that amount of time.

Persistent Balance Issues: It's no secret that Overwatch faced its fair share of balance complaints. We hoped that with Overwatch 2, Blizzard would have taken the feedback to heart and made necessary adjustments. However, the balance issues persist, leading to repetitive metas, gameplay frustration, and the sidelining of some heroes entirely. What was the point of a sequel if not to address and refine these foundational elements?

Déjà Vu Gameplay: Drawing parallels between Overwatch 2 and its predecessor is inevitable, but the similarities are startling. Instead of feeling like a sequel, Overwatch 2 feels more like an "Overwatch 1.5." The maps, mechanics, and overall gameplay remain so unchanged that it's hard to justify the sequel's existence. Sequels should take risks, innovate, and expand upon the original's framework. Overwatch 2 feels too familiar and lacks innovation.

Broken Promises: Many players, including myself, were looking forward to the promised PvE mode with RPG elements – a potential game-changer that could have set Overwatch 2 apart from the original. The absence of this feature is not only disappointing but downright misleading for fans who were waiting with bated breath. The game promised evolution and delivered regression.

In conclusion, Overwatch 2 feels like a missed opportunity. Instead of crafting a game that built upon the successes and lessons of the original, Blizzard appears to have played it safe – and even taken a step back. While the graphics may be shinier and the roster expanded, at its core, Overwatch 2 fails to capture the magic and innovation that its predecessor brought to the table. One can only hope that future updates will address these glaring issues, but for now, Overwatch 2 stands as a lesson in how not to craft a sequel.
